            android:src="@tools:sample/avatars" <!-- Proporciona una imagen de ejemplo en el ImageView. -->
            app:srcCompat="@color/material_dynamic_neutral70" /> <!-- Proporciona compatibilidad hacia atrás para la imagen en el ImageView. -->

        <LinearLayout
            android:layout_width="match_parent" <!-- Este LinearLayout se expande para igualar el ancho de su contenedor padre. -->
            android:layout_height="wrap_content" <!-- La altura de este LinearLayout se ajusta para contener a sus elementos hijo. -->
            android:orientation="horizontal" <!-- Organiza sus elementos hijo en una fila horizontal. --> >

            <Button
                android:id="@+id/btnEditar" <!-- Asigna un ID único al botón de editar. -->
                android:layout_width="wrap_content" <!-- El botón se expande para igualar el ancho de su contenido. -->
                android:layout_height="wrap_content" <!-- El botón se expande para igualar la altura de su contenido. -->
                android:layout_weight="1" <!-- Asigna peso de 1 dentro del LinearLayout para distribución del espacio. -->
                android:backgroundTint="#000000" <!-- Color de fondo del botón (tinte) es negro. -->
                android:layout_marginEnd="10dp" <!-- Margen final de 10dp para el botón. -->
                android:text="Editar"/> <!-- Texto que se muestra en el botón es "Editar". -->

            <Button
                android:id="@+id/btnImagen" <!-- Asigna un ID único al botón para añadir imagen. -->
                android:layout_width="wrap_content" <!-- El botón se expande para igualar el ancho de su contenido. -->
                android:layout_height="wrap_content" <!-- El botón se expande para igualar la altura de su contenido. -->
                android:layout_weight="1" <!-- Asigna peso de 1 dentro del LinearLayout para distribución del espacio. -->
                android:backgroundTint="#000000" <!-- Color de fondo del botón (tinte) es negro. -->
                android:layout_marginStart="10dp" <!-- Margen inicial de 10dp para el botón. -->
                android:text="Añadir Imagen" /> <!-- Texto que se muestra en el botón es "Añadir Imagen". -->

        </LinearLayout> <!-- Fin del LinearLayout para los botones. -->

    </LinearLayout> <!-- Fin del LinearLayout para el contenido principal. -->

</LinearLayout> <!-- Fin del LinearLayout raíz. -->

#!/bin/bash

# Loop over all Java files in the current directory
for java_file in *.java; do
    # Check if there's a DataColumn annotation in the file
    if grep -q "@DataColumn" "$java_file"; then
        # If found, process each line having DataColumn
        grep "@DataColumn" "$java_file" | while read -r line; do
            # Extract and print the dataName and name property from the annotation
            
            # Get the line with the field declaration
            field_line=$(grep -A 1 "@DataColumn" "$java_file" | tail -n1)

            # Extract the field name
            data_name=$(echo "$field_line" | awk '{print $NF}' | sed 's/;//')

            # Extract the value of name property
            name_value=$(echo "$line" | grep -oP '(?<=name = ")[^"]*' )

            # Print the result
            echo "$data_name= $name_value"
        done
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

# Go through each java file in the current directory
for file in *.java; do
    # Extract the name property in DataColumn annotation along with the data name
    grep -oP '@DataColumn\(name = "\K[^"]+' "$file" | while read -r data_name; do
        grep -oP 'private \w+ (\w+);\s*$' "$file" | while read -r variable_line; do
            # Extract the data type and variable name
            variable_name=$(echo "$variable_line" | awk '{print $3}' | sed 's/;//')
            data_type=$(echo "$variable_line" | awk '{print $2}')
            # Print the data name and the associated name property in DataColumn annotation
            echo "$variable_name= $data_name"
        done
    done
done

#!/bin/bash

# Чтение содержимого файла построчно
while IFS= read -r line
do
    if [[ $line == *"|- | {| class=\"standard-table\" style=\"width: 100%\";"* ]]; then
        echo '{| class="standard-table" style="width: 100%";'
    elif [[ $line == "*| ! Command !! Default Value !! Flags !! Description"* ]]; then
        echo '! Command !! Default Value !! Flags !! Description'
    else
        echo "$line"
    fi
done < "file.txt" > tmpfile && mv tmpfile file.txt

#!/bin/bash

# Función para solicitar los datos al usuario y comprobar su validez
solicitar_datos() {
    read -p "Introduce tu nombre: " nombre
    read -p "Introduce tu apellido: " apellido
    read -p "Introduce tu edad: " edad
    
    # Comprobar si los datos son válidos. Por simplicidad, solamente comprobamos si no están vacíos.
    if [[ -z "$nombre" ]] || [[ -z "$apellido" ]] || [[ -z "$edad" ]]; then
        return 1
    else
        return 0
    fi
}

# Llamar a la función y comprobar el resultado
if solicitar_datos; then
    echo "Bienvenido/a $nombre $apellido, tienes $edad años."
else
    echo "Error: Debes introducir los datos correctamente."
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Función para validar la edad
validar_edad() {
    re='^[0-9]+$'
    if ! [[ $1 =~ $re ]] ; then
       echo "Error: La edad debe ser un número." >&2; return 1
    fi
    return 0
}

# Pide al usuario su nombre
read -p "Por favor, introduce tu nombre: " nombre
# Verifica que el nombre no esté vacío
if [[ -z "$nombre" ]]; then
    echo "Debes introducir un nombre."
    exit 1
fi

# Pide al usuario su apellido
read -p "Por favor, introduce tu apellido: " apellido
# Verifica que el apellido no esté vacío
if [[ -z "$apellido" ]]; then
    echo "Debes introducir un apellido."
    exit 1
fi

# Pide al usuario su edad
read -p "Por favor, introduce tu edad: " edad
# Verifica que la edad sea un número con la función validar_edad
if ! validar_edad "$edad"; then
    exit 1
fi

# Si todo está correcto, saluda al usuario
echo "Bienvenido/a $nombre $apellido, tienes $edad años de edad."

#!/bin/bash

# Función para pedir datos al usuario
pedir_datos(){
    read -p "Ingresa tu nombre: " nombre
    read -p "Ingresa tu apellido: " apellido
    read -p "Ingresa tu edad: " edad

    # Validamos que la edad sea un número
    if ! [[ "$edad" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
        echo "Error: La edad debe ser un número."
        return 1
    fi

    # Verificamos que ni el nombre ni el apellido estén vacíos
    if [ -z "$nombre" ] || [ -z "$apellido" ]; then
        echo "Error: El nombre y el apellido no pueden estar vacíos."
        return 1
    fi

    return 0
}

# Intentamos pedir los datos al usuario
if pedir_datos; then
    echo "Bienvenido $nombre $apellido, que tengas un hermoso día. Veo que tienes $edad años."
else
    echo "Se introdujeron incorrectamente los datos. Por favor, intenta de nuevo."
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Función para solicitar datos al usuario
pedir_datos() {
    read -p "Introduce tu nombre: " nombre
    read -p "Introduce tu apellido: " apellido
    read -p "Introduce tu edad: " edad

    # Verificar si se introdujeron los datos correctamente
    if [[ -z "$nombre" || -z "$apellido" || -z "$edad" ]]; then
        echo "Por favor, introduce todos los datos solicitados."
        return 1
    fi

    # Verificar si la edad es un número
    if ! [[ "$edad" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
        echo "La edad debe ser un número. Por favor, inténtalo de nuevo."
        return 1
    fi

    return 0
}

# Ciclo para pedir datos hasta que estén correctos
while true; do
    pedir_datos

    # Si los datos fueron introducidos correctamente, da la bienvenida y termina el ciclo
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        echo "Bienvenido/a $nombre $apellido, tu edad es $edad años."
        break
    else
        echo "Inténtalo de nuevo."
    fi
done

retry_count=0
max_retries=5

until your-command; do
  (( retry_count++ ))
  if [ $retry_count -eq $max_retries ]; then
    echo "Command failed after $max_retries attempts."
    break
  fi
  echo "Command failed... retrying in 1 second (attempt $retry_count)."
  sleep 1
done

until your-command; do
  retval=$?
  if [ $retval -ne <specific_error_code> ]; then
    echo "Command failed with unexpected error code $retval."
    break
  fi
  echo "Command failed with expected error... retrying in 1 second."
  sleep 1
done

#!/bin/bash

while true; do
    # Run your command here, e.g.,
    your_command

    exit_status=$?

    # Check if the command exited because of a timeout or interruption
    if [ $exit_status -eq <specific_exit_code_for_timeout_or_interrupt> ]; then
        echo "Command failed with timeout or was interrupted. Retrying..."
        sleep 1 # Wait for a second before retrying, if necessary
    else
        echo "Command finished with different exit status: $exit_status"
        break # Exit the loop if the command finishes normally or has a different error
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

# Función de suma
suma() {
    echo "Resultado: $(($1 + $2))"
}

# Función de resta
resta() {
    echo "Resultado: $(($1 - $2))"
}

# Función de multiplicación
multiplicacion() {
    echo "Resultado: $(($1 * $2))"
}

# Función de división
division() {
    if [ $2 -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "Error: División por cero no es posible."
    else
        echo "Resultado: $(($1 / $2))"
    fi
}

# Pedir al usuario los números
echo "Introduce el primer número:"
read num1
echo "Introduce el segundo número:"
read num2

# Pedir al usuario la operación a realizar
echo "Selecciona la operación:"
echo "1) Suma"
echo "2) Resta"
echo "3) Multiplicación"
echo "4) División"
read operacion

# Ejecutar la operación deseada
case $operacion in
    1)
        suma $num1 $num2
        ;;
    2)
        resta $num1 $num2
        ;;
    3)
        multiplicacion $num1 $num2
        ;;
    4)
        division $num1 $num2
        ;;
    *)
        echo "Opción inválida."
        ;;
esac

"199.250.160.129"
"209.192.253.60"
"edge.presslabs.net"
"edge-star-shv-02-bom2.facebook.com"

"prebid.lax1.adnexus.net"
"ip-185-184-8-90.rtbhouse.net"
"ip-216-169-156-30.rtbhouse.net"
)

# Loop through each IP address and run the whois command
for ip in "${ips[@]}"
do
  echo "Retrieving information for: $ip"
  
  # Use dig to resolve domain names to IP addresses
  if [[ $ip =~ ^[a-zA-Z] ]]; then
    actual_ip=$(dig +short $ip)
    echo "Resolved domain $ip to IP: $actual_ip"
    whois $actual_ip
  else
    whois $ip
  fi
  
  # Pause between each whois command to avoid being rate-limited by the whois servers
  sleep 1
done

echo "Information retrieval complete."

#!/bin/bash

URL="YOUR_VIDEO_URL_HERE"  # Replace with the URL you want to check
FORMAT_CODE="251"          # Format code to check for

# Function to check if the format is available
is_format_available() {
    yt-dlp -F "$URL" | grep -q "format code $FORMAT_CODE"
    return $?
}

# Main loop, keep querying until the format is available
while true; do
    if is_format_available; then
        echo "Format $FORMAT_CODE is available, starting download..."
        yt-dlp -f "$FORMAT_CODE" "$URL"
        break
    else
        echo "Format $FORMAT_CODE is not available yet, retrying in 30 seconds..."
        sleep 30
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

        yt-dlp -f "$FORMAT_CODE" "$URL"
        break
    else
        echo "Format $FORMAT_CODE not available yet. Retrying in 60 seconds..."
        sleep 60
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

# Путь к директории, которую надо обойти
input_directory='.'

# Файл для записи результатов
output_file='biblio.txt'

# Удаление файла с результатами, если он существует
rm -f "${output_file}"

# Основной цикл, проходящий через все папки и файлы в директории
find "${input_directory}" -type f -print0 | while IFS= read -r -d $'\0' file; do
    # Извлечение базового имени файла (без пути)
    base_name=$(basename -- "$file")

    # Удаление расширения файла
    # Если у файла несколько расширений, удалится только последнее (например, "archive.tar.gz" превратится в "archive.tar")
    name_without_extension="${base_name%.*}"

    # Добавление названия файла без расширения в результат
    echo "${name_without_extension}" >> "${output_file}"
done

# Сортировка и удаление дубликатов в файле biblio.txt
sort -u "${output_file}" -o "${output_file}"

#!/bin/bash

# Путь к директории, в которой будем искать файлы
SEARCH_DIR="./"

# Путь к файлу, в который будут записаны результаты
OUTPUT_FILE="biblio.txt"

# Очистка файла biblio.txt или создание, если он не существует
> "$OUTPUT_FILE"

# Поиск всех файлов в указанной директории и ее поддиректориях
find "$SEARCH_DIR" -type f | while read -r file; do
  # Извлечение имени файла без пути до него и расширения
  filename=$(basename "$file" | sed 's/\.[^.]*$//')
  # Запись имени файла в biblio.txt
  echo "$filename" >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
done

exit 0

#!/bin/bash

# Файл для записи
output="biblio.txt"

# Очистка файла biblio.txt
> "$output"

# Путь к исключаемой папке
exclude_path="/геймдев/Disk/"

# Функция для обработки найденных файлов
process_file() {
  local file_path="$1"
  # Удаляем расширение файла
  local file_name=$(basename "${file_path}" | sed 's/\.[^.]*$//')
  # Записываем имя файла в файл biblio.txt
  echo "$file_name" >> "$output"
}

# Функция для обхода папок и записи имен файлов
find_files() {
  local parent_dir="$1"
  # Используем find для поиска файлов
  find "$parent_dir" -type f ! -path "$exclude_path*" | while read file; do
    # Обрабатываем каждый файл
    process_file "$file"
  done
}

# Запускаем поиск файлов в текущей директории
find_files "."

echo "Список файлов записан в $output"

@echo off

:copy

echo Copying %1
xcopy "%~1" "%destination%"
shift
goto copy
:done
echo Done copying files.

@echo off
set destination=\\10.202.12.20\import\smbimp1
:Loop
if "%~1"=="" goto EndLoop
xcopy /Y /I "%~1" "%destination%"
shift
goto Loop
:EndLoop
echo Files copied successfully.
pause

#!/bin/bash

# Переходим в директорию с картинками
cd /path/to/directory

# Инициализируем счётчик
COUNTER=65

# Находим все jpg файлы в текущей директории, сортируем их
FILES=$(ls *.jpg | sort -V)

for FILE in $FILES; do
    # Форматируем номер файла с ведущими нулями
    FORMATTED_COUNTER=$(printf "%03d" $COUNTER)
    
    # Переименовываем файл, предполагая что файлы имеют формат ".jpg"
    mv "$FILE" "$FORMATTED_COUNTER.jpg"
    
    # Увеличиваем счётчик
    let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
done

echo "Переименование файлов завершено."

#!/bin/bash

# Задайте путь к папке с изображениями
dir="/path/to/your/images"

# Инициализация счетчика для новых имен файлов
counter=65

# Получаем список jpg файлов, сортируем их по имени и переименовываем последовательно
find "$dir" -name '*.jpg' | sort | while read -r file; do 
  # Форматируем счётчик, добавляя нужное количество нулей перед номером
  printf -v new_name "%03d.jpg" "$counter"

  # Переименовываем файлы
  mv "$file" "$(dirname "$file")/$new_name"
  let counter=counter+1
done

echo "Renaming completed."

# 在图片目录下创建一个文件列表
for f in /path/to/images/*.jpg; do echo "file '$f'" >> mylist.txt; done

# 使用这个文件列表合并为视频
ffmpeg -f concat -safe 0 -i mylist.txt -vsync vfr -pix_fmt yuv420p output.mp4

#!/bin/bash

echo "¿Está seguro que quiere hacer este proceso? Escoja entre \"Sí\" y \"No\"."
read opc1 

# Corrección de la sintaxis de la condicional if, uso de == para comparación de strings
# y uso de las comillas necesarias alrededor de la variable ${opc1}
if [ "${opc1}" == "Sí" ]; then
    # Asumiendo que se refiere al directorio Documentos del directorio home del usuario

    find ~/Documentos -type f -name "*.sh" -exec rm {} \;
    echo "Sus scripts fueron eliminados correctamente."
elif [ "${opc1}" == "No" ]; then
    # No necesitas el comando exit, un elif sin debería ser suficiente
    echo "Operación cancelada por el usuario."
else
    # Removido el test innecesario y corregidas las comillas dentro del mensaje
    echo "Asegúrese de escribir bien \"Sí\" o \"No\", escrito tal cual, con tilde, y mayúscula."
fi

<?php

// Pfad zur Vue.js-Build-Datei (dist/index.html)
$vueAppEntry = 'app/dist/index.html';
// Basisordner für API-Anfragen
$apiPrefix = '/api';

// Erhalten Sie den URI-Pfad aus der Anfrage
$requestUri = parse_url($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], PHP_URL_PATH);

// Bedienen Sie API-Anfragen im "/api"-Pfad
if (strpos($requestUri, $apiPrefix) === 0) {
    // Verweisen auf das API-Verzeichnis
    $filePath = __DIR__ . $requestUri;
    // Wenn die angeforderte PHP-Datei existiert, binden wir sie ein
    if (file_exists($filePath) && is_file($filePath)) {
        return false; // Verarbeiten Sie die Anfrage wie gewohnt
    } else {
        // Hier könnten Sie das Routing für Ihre API-Endpunkte einrichten oder einen Fehler senden
        header("HTTP/1.0 404 Not Found");
        echo "API endpoint not found";
        exit;
    }
} else {
    // Für alle anderen Anfragen dienen Sie die Vue App
    // Leiten Sie alle nicht-Datei-Anfragen an die Vue.js Single Page Application um
    $filePath = __DIR__ . '/app/dist' . $requestUri;
    if (!file_exists($filePath) || is_dir($filePath)) {
        $filePath = __DIR__ . '/' . $vueAppEntry;
    }

    // Existierende Dateien oder Verzeichnisse direkt ausliefern
    if (file_exists($filePath) && is_file($filePath)) {
        return false; // Lässt den eingebauten PHP-Server die Anfrage auf die Datei bedienen
    } else {
        // Senden Sie ansonsten die Anfrage an Ihre Vue.js App
        include_once $vueAppEntry;
    }
}

<?php

// Pfad zur Vue.js-Build-Datei (dist/index.html)
$vueAppEntry = 'app/dist/index.html';

// Basisordner für API-Anfragen
$apiPrefix = '/api';

// Erhalten Sie den URI-Pfad aus der Anfrage
$requestUri = parse_url($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], PHP_URL_PATH);

// Bedienen Sie API-Anfragen im “/api”-Pfad
if (strpos($requestUri, $apiPrefix) === 0) {
    // Verweisen auf das API-Verzeichnis
    $filePath = __DIR__ . '/api' . substr($requestUri, strlen($apiPrefix));

    // Prüfen, ob die angeforderte API-Datei existiert und auch eine PHP-Datei ist
    if (file_exists($filePath) && is_file($filePath) && pathinfo($filePath, PATHINFO_EXTENSION) === 'php') {
        // Beziehen Sie die API-Datei ein
        include $filePath;
    } else {
        // Senden Sie einen 404, wenn die Datei nicht existiert
        header('HTTP/1.0 404 Not Found');
        echo '404 Not Found';
    }
} else {
    // Wenn die Anfrage nicht mit “/api” beginnt, dienen wir die statische Vue.js-App aus
    // Beachten Sie, dass Sie hier sicherstellen sollten, dass Sie nur Dateien ausliefern, die tatsächlich ausgeliefert werden sollten.
    if (file_exists($vueAppEntry)) {
        // Liefert die Vue.js Single Page Application aus
        include $vueAppEntry;
    } else {
        // Senden Sie einen 404, wenn die SPA-Startseite nicht gefunden wird
        header('HTTP/1.0 404 Not Found');
        echo '404 Not Found - SPA Entry Point Missing';
    }
}

?>

<?php

// router.php

// Überprüfen Sie den angeforderten Pfad
$requestedUri = parse_url($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], PHP_URL_PATH);

// Entscheiden, ob die Anfrage zum 'api'-Verzeichnis weitergeleitet werden soll oder zu den statischen Dateien im 'app/dist'-Verzeichnis
if (strpos($requestedUri, '/api') === 0) {
    // PHP API Anfragen werden zum 'api'-Verzeichnis weitergeleitet
    $pathToScript = __DIR__ . '/api' . $requestedUri;
    if (file_exists($pathToScript) && is_file($pathToScript)) {
        include $pathToScript;
    } else {
        // API-Skript nicht gefunden, sende 404
        header("HTTP/1.0 404 Not Found");
        echo '404 Not Found';
    }
} else {
    // Statische Dateien für die Vue Anwendung werden aus dem 'app/dist'-Verzeichnis geladen
    $pathToResource = __DIR__ . '/app/dist' . $requestedUri;
    if (is_file($pathToResource)) {
        // Bestimmung des korrekten Content-Types
        $mimeType = mime_content_type($pathToResource);
        header("Content-Type: " . $mimeType);
        readfile($pathToResource);
    } else {
        // Datei nicht gefunden als Fallback die index.html Datei der Vue-Anwendung laden
        header("Content-Type: text/html");
        readfile(__DIR__ . '/app/dist/index.html');
    }
}

#!/bin/bash

# Assign input file variables
audio_input="audio_acc.mp4"
video_input="video.avi"
cover_image="Cover.webp"
output_file="sc-test-crf22-4.mkv"

# Check if necessary input files exist
if [[ ! -f "$audio_input" ]]; then
  echo "Audio input file $audio_input does not exist."
  exit 1
fi

if [[ ! -f "$video_input" ]]; then
  echo "Video input file $video_input does not exist."
  exit 1
fi

if [[ ! -f "$cover_image" ]]; then
  echo "Cover image file $cover_image does not exist."
  exit 1
fi

# Command to run ffmpeg conversion
ffmpeg -i "$audio_input" -i "$video_input" \
  -attach "$cover_image" \
  -metadata title="Cover" \
  -metadata:s:t:0 filename="$cover_image" \
  -metadata:s:t:0 mimetype="image/webp" \
  -c:v libx265 -preset medium -tune psnr \
  -x265-params "qp=16:rc-lookahead=18" \
  -crf 22 \
  -filter_complex "scale=2560:1440,loop=loop=-1:size=65:start=1" \
  -t 00:01:00.1 \
  -movflags +write_colr -movflags +faststart \
  -tag:v hvc1 \
  "$output_file"

# Check if the output file was created successfully
if [[ -f "$output_file" ]]; then
  echo "Conversion completed: $output_file"
else
  echo "Conversion failed."
fi

exit 0

#!/bin/bash

# Assign input and output filenames
audio_file="audio_acc.mp4"
video_file="video.avi"
output_file="sc-test-crf22-4.mkv"
cover_image="Cover.webp"

# Check if input files exist
if [ ! -f "$audio_file" ] || [ ! -f "$video_file" ] || [ ! -f "$cover_image" ]; then
    echo "Error: One or more input files does not exist."
    exit 1
fi

# Execute ffmpeg command
ffmpeg -i "$audio_file" \
       -i "$video_file" \
       -attach "$cover_image" \
       -metadata title="Cover" \
       -metadata:s:t:0 filename="Cover.webp" \
       -metadata:s:t:0 mimetype="image/webp" \
       -c:v libx265 \
       -preset medium \
       -tune psnr \
       -x265-params "qp=16:rc-lookahead=18" \
       -crf 22 \
       -filter_complex "scale=2560:1440,loop=loop=-1:size=65:start=1" \
       -t 00:01:00.1 \
       -movflags +write_colr \
       -movflags +faststart \
       -tag:v hvc1 \
       "$output_file"

# Check if ffmpeg command was successful
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Error: ffmpeg command failed."
    exit 1
fi

echo "Conversion complete: '$output_file' has been created."

#!/bin/bash

# Check if enough arguments are provided
if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
  echo "Usage: $0 <audio_acc.mp4> <video.avi>"
  exit 1
fi

# Assign readable names to the input arguments
audio_acc_file="$1"
video_file="$2"
output_file="sc-test-crf22-4.mkv"

# Run the FFmpeg command with the specified options on the inputs
ffmpeg -i "$audio_acc_file" -i "$video_file" -attach "Cover.webp" \
  -metadata title="Cover" \
  -metadata:s:t:0 filename="Cover.webp" \
  -metadata:s:t:0 mimetype="image/webp" \
  -c:v libx265 -preset medium -tune psnr \
  -x265-params "qp=16:rc-lookahead=18" -crf 22 \
  -filter_complex "scale=2560:1440,loop=loop=-1:size=65:start=1" \
  -t 00:01:00.1 -movflags +write_colr -movflags +faststart \
  -tag:v hvc1 \
  "$output_file"

# Check if FFmpeg exited successfully
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "Conversion successful, created '$output_file'"
else
  echo "FFmpeg failed, please check the input files and parameters."
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Define the output image file
OUTPUT_IMAGE="output.png"

# Create the GNUplot script
gnuplot -persist <<-EOFMarker
  # Set terminal to png image
  set terminal png size 800,600
  
  # Set the output file
  set output '${OUTPUT_IMAGE}'

  # Set titles and labels
  set title "Threads vs Time Taken"
  set xlabel "Number of Threads"
  set ylabel "Time taken in seconds"

  # Set grid
  set grid

  # Set the keys
  set key outside

  # Plot the data
  plot "Merge.dat" using 1:2 with linespoints title 'Merge' lt rgb "red", \
       "Count.dat" using 1:2 with linespoints title 'Count' lt rgb "blue", \
       "Quick.dat" using 1:2 with linespoints title 'Quick' lt rgb "green"
EOFMarker

echo "Plot has been generated at ${OUTPUT_IMAGE}"

#!/bin/sh

# Define output image file
output="comparison_plot.png"

# Create the gnuplot script
gnuplot_script="
set terminal png size 1024,768
set output '$output'

set title 'Threads vs. Time Taken'
set xlabel 'Number of threads'
set ylabel 'Time taken (seconds)'

set grid
set key outside

plot 'Merge.dat' using 1:2 with linespoints title 'Merge Sort' lt rgb 'red', \\
     'Count.dat' using 1:2 with linespoints title 'Count Sort' lt rgb 'blue', \\
     'Quick.dat' using 1:2 with linespoints title 'Quick Sort' lt rgb 'green'
"

# Execute the gnuplot script
echo "$gnuplot_script" | gnuplot

# Display the output image (optional, remove if unwanted)
xdg-open "$output"

version: '2'

    services:
      rocketchat:
        image: rocket.chat:latest
        command: >
          bash -c
          "for i in `seq 1 30`; do
            node main.js &&
            s=$$? && break || s=$$?;
            echo \"Tried $$i times. Waiting 5 secs...\";
            sleep 5;
          done; (exit $$s)"
        restart: unless-stopped
        volumes:
          - ./uploads:/app/uploads
        environment:
          - PORT=3000
          - ROOT_URL=http://localhost:3000
          - MONGO_URL=mongodb://mongo:27017/rocketchat
          - MONGO_OPLOG_URL=mongodb://mongo:27017/local
        depends_on:
          - mongo
        ports:
          - "3000:3000"
    
      mongo:
        image: mongo:4.0
        restart: unless-stopped
        command: mongod --smallfiles --oplogSize 128 --replSet rs0 --storageEngine=mmapv1
        volumes:
         - ./data/db:/data/db
       
      # Optional: MongoDB Management Service
      mongo-express:
        image: mongo-express
        restart: unless-stopped
        depends_on:
          - mongo
        ports:
          - "8081:8081"
        environment:
          - ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_SERVER=mongo
          - ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_ADMINUSERNAME=<YourAdminUsername>
          - ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_ADMINPASSWORD=<YourAdminPassword>

@echo off
setlocal EnableDelayedExpansion

:: Initialize a variable for the password
set "password="

:: Define string length
set /a length=12

:: Define character sets
set "lowercase=abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
set "uppercase=ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
set "numbers=0123456789"
set "special=()!@#$%^&*_-+="

:: Combine all characters into one string
set "allChars=!lowercase!!uppercase!!numbers!!special!"

:generatePassword
if not "!length!" == "0" (
    set /a "charIndex=!random! %% 62"
    set "char=!allChars:~%charIndex%,1!"
    
    :: Add the random character to the password
    set "password=!password!!char!"
    
    :: Decrease length
    set /a length-=1
    
    :: Repeat the process until the password reaches the desired length
    goto generatePassword
)

:: Output the generated password
echo Generated Password: !password!

endlocal
pause

# Adjusting the Firewall

# Installing MySQL

# Running the security script
sudo mysql_secure_installation

# Installing PHP

# Restarting Apache to apply PHP changes

#!/bin/bash

# Variables - Customize these
GLPI_VERSION="10.0.2" # Check https://github.com/glpi-project/glpi/releases for the latest version
DB_NAME="glpidb"
DB_USER="glpi_user"
DB_PASSWORD="your_password" # Use a strong password

# Downloading GLPI
cd /tmp
wget https://github.com/glpi-project/glpi/releases/download/${GLPI_VERSION}/glpi-${GLPI_VERSION}.tgz

# Extracting GLPI
tar -xzf glpi-${GLPI_VERSION}.tgz

# Moving GLPI files to the Apache directory
sudo mv glpi /var/www/html

# Changing ownership of the GLPI folder
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/html/glpi

# Setting permissions
sudo chmod -R 755 /var/www/html/glpi

# Creating a MySQL database and user for GLPI

@echo off
setlocal enabledelayedexpansion

REM Path to WinRAR.exe
set WINRAR_PATH=%ProgramFiles%\WinRAR\WinRAR.exe

REM Directory where your files are located
set SOURCE_DIR=YourSourceDirectoryHere

REM Temporary directory for ZIP files
set TEMP_DIR=%SOURCE_DIR%\temp
mkdir "%TEMP_DIR%"

REM Change directory to your files location
cd /d "%SOURCE_DIR%"

REM Loop through each file and create a .zip archive
for %%F in (*.*) do (
    "%WINRAR_PATH%" a -afzip "%TEMP_DIR%\%%~nF.zip" "%%F"
)

REM Change directory to temporary ZIP files
cd /d "%TEMP_DIR%"

REM Rename .zip files to .arcv
for %%F in (*.zip) do (
    ren "%%F" "%%~nF.arcv"
)

REM Optionally move .arcv files back to source directory
move "*.arcv" "%SOURCE_DIR%"

REM Cleanup and remove temporary directory
cd /d "%SOURCE_DIR%"
rmdir /s /q "%TEMP_DIR%"

echo Process completed.
pause

# 定义计算 CPU 使用率的函数
calculate_cpu_usage() {
    pid=$1
    interval=1  # 时间间隔，单位为秒
    previous_time=$(date +%s%N | cut -b1-13)
    previous_cpu_time=$(cat /proc/$pid/stat | awk '{print $14+$15}')

    while true; do
        sleep $interval
        current_time=$(date +%s%N | cut -b1-13)
        current_cpu_time=$(cat /proc/$pid/stat | awk '{print $14+$15}')

        cpu_delta=$(($current_cpu_time - $previous_cpu_time))
        time_delta=$(($current_time - $previous_time))
        cpu_percentage=$(($cpu_delta * 100 / $time_delta))

        echo "PID $pid CPU 使用率: $cpu_percentage%"

        previous_time=$current_time
        previous_cpu_time=$current_cpu_time
    done
}

# 调用函数计算指定进程的 CPU 使用率
process_pid=1234  # 替换为要监控的进程的实际 PID
calculate_cpu_usage $process_pid

<?php
$host = '0.0.0.0';
$port = 8000;
set_time_limit(0);

$sock = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
socket_bind($sock, $host, $port);
socket_listen($sock);

echo "Listening on $host:$port...\n";

$client = socket_accept($sock);

$request = socket_read($client, 1024);
echo "Request:\n\n$request\n\n";

// Hier setzen wir die notwendigen CORS-Header
$headers = "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n";
$headers .= "Content-Type: text/plain\r\n";
// Erlaubt Anfragen von jeglicher Herkunft
$headers .= "Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *\r\n";
// Optional: Headers festlegen, die während der tatsächlichen Anfrage genutzt werden dürfen
$headers .= "Access-Control-Allow-Headers: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept\r\n";
// Response Body
$body = "Hello, World!";

$response = $headers . "\r\n" . $body;

socket_write($client, $response);
socket_close($client);
socket_close($sock);

#!/bin/bash

# Check if a folder name was provided as an argument
if [ "$#" -ne 1 ]; then
  echo "Folder name not provided as an argument."
  read -p "Please enter the name of the folder to zip and save to /dev/tape: " foldername
else
  foldername="$1"
fi

# Check if the specified folder exists
if [ ! -d "$foldername" ]; then
  echo "The specified folder does not exist."
  exit 1
fi

# Create a compressed file from the folder. Adjust the compression command if necessary.
# Using 'tar' here to create a gzip compressed file.
compressedFile="${foldername}-$(date +%Y-%m-%d).tar.gz"
tar -czf "$compressedFile" "$foldername"

# Check if the compressed file has been created successfully.
if [ ! -f "$compressedFile" ]; then
  echo "Failed to create the compressed file."
  exit 1
fi

echo "Compressed file $compressedFile created successfully."

# Writing the compressed file to /dev/tape
echo "Writing $compressedFile to /dev/tape..."
dd if="$compressedFile" of=/dev/tape

# Check if the write operation was successful
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "File successfully written to /dev/tape."
else
  echo "Failed to write the file to /dev/tape."
  exit 1
fi

# Cleanup or leave the compressed file based on your requirement
# Uncomment the next line if you wish to delete the compressed file after writing it to /dev/tape
# rm "$compressedFile"

clear

# Compile in parallel
$COMPILER $STANDARD -c $OPTIMISATION -flto src/sockets.cpp -o out/sockets.o &
$COMPILER $STANDARD -c $OPTIMISATION -flto src/thread_pool.cpp -o out/thread_pool.o &
$COMPILER $STANDARD -c $OPTIMISATION -flto src/mime_types.cpp -o out/mime_types.o &

$COMPILER $STANDARD -c $OPTIMISATION -flto src/dev_server.cpp -o out/dev_server.o &

# Wait for all compile jobs to finish
wait

# Link only if all compile jobs succeeded
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
    $COMPILER -o out/dev_server out/*.o $OPTIMISATION -flto $LIB &&
    echo "Compilation and linking successful."
else
    echo "Compilation failed."
    exit 1
fi

# Clean up object files
rm out/*.o

# Execute the server
./out/dev_server

#!/bin/bash

# Nom du fichier CSV de sortie
outputFile="certificates_info.csv"

# En-tête du fichier CSV
echo "URL,Certificate Validity" > "$outputFile"

# Boucle à travers chaque ligne/url dans le fichier url.txt
while IFS= read -r url
do
    # Utilisez openssl pour obtenir les dates de validité du certificat
    validity=$(echo | openssl s_client -servername "$url" -connect "$url":443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -noout -dates | grep 'notAfter' | cut -d'=' -f2)
    
    # Formatage de la date de validité (Optionnel, selon le format désiré)
    validityFormatted=$(date -d "$validity" "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M")

    # Ajoutez l'URL et la validité dans le fichier CSV
    echo "$url,$validityFormatted" >> "$outputFile"

done < "url.txt"

echo "Terminé. Vérifiez le fichier $outputFile."

#!/bin/bash

# Le nom de fichier du fichier CSV de sortie.
output_file="certificates_validity.csv"

# Écrivez l'en-tête du CSV.
echo "URL,Certificate Validity" > "$output_file"

# Lisez chaque ligne de url.txt.
while IFS= read -r url; do
    if [[ ! -z "$url" ]]; then # Vérifie si la ligne n'est pas vide.
        # Utilisez testssl.sh pour obtenir la validité du certificat et extrayez les lignes pertinentes.
        validity=$(./testssl.sh --quiet --fast --openssl-timeout 5 "$url" | grep -E 'Certificate validity' | grep ">= 60 days" )
      
        # Si la sortie contient des informations de validité, l'écrire dans le fichier CSV.
        if [[ ! -z "$validity" ]]; then
            # Nettoyez la sortie pour obtenir seulement la période de validité.
            cleaned_validity=$(echo "$validity" | sed -E 's/.*\(UTC\) //g')
            # Écrivez les données dans le fichier CSV.
            echo "$url,$cleaned_validity" >> "$output_file"
        else
            echo "$url,Info not found" >> "$output_file"
        fi
    fi
done < "url.txt"

#!/bin/bash

# Nettoyer le fichier CSV s'il existe et ajouter l'en-tête
echo "URL,Certificate Validity" > urls_certificates.csv

while read -r url; do
  # Générez le rapport de testssl ici. Exemple factice:
  # ./testssl.sh --quiet --openssl-timeout 120 "$url" > "$url_report"
  url_report="${url}_report.txt"
  
  # Extrait la validité du certificat. Assurez-vous que `grep` correspond à votre format de rapport exact.
  certificate_validity=$(grep -oP 'Certificate Validity \(UTC\).*' "$url_report")
  
  # Enregistrez l'URL et la validité du certificat dans le fichier csv
  echo "$url,$certificate_validity" >> urls_certificates.csv
  
  # Nettoyer si nécessaire
  # rm "$url_report"
done < url.txt

#!/bin/bash

input_file="urls.txt"
output_file="results.csv"

# En-tête du fichier CSV
echo "URL,Certificate Validity (UTC)" > "$output_file"

# Boucle à travers chaque URL du fichier d'entrée
while IFS= read -r url; do
    # Supprimer les espaces en début et fin d'URL
    url=$(echo "$url" | tr -d '[:space:]')
    
    # Vérifier si l'URL est vide
    if [ -z "$url" ]; then
        continue
    fi
    
    # Utiliser testssl et extraire uniquement la validité du certificat 
    output=$(testssl --quiet "$url" 2>/dev/null | grep -i 'Certificate Validity (UTC)' | head -n 1)
    
    # Nettoyer la sortie pour enlever les séquences d'échappement ANSI
    # et formatter pour ne garder que les informations essentielles
    clean_output=$(echo "$output" | sed -e 's/\x1b\[[0-9;]*m//g' -e 's/Certificate Validity (UTC)[[:space:]]*//')

    # Vérifier si clean_output est vide
    if [ -z "$clean_output" ]; then
        clean_output="Certificate information not found"
    fi
    
    # Ajouter les résultats au fichier CSV
    echo "$url,\"$clean_output\"" >> "$output_file"
done < "$input_file"

echo "Le fichier CSV a été créé avec succès : $output_file"

#!/bin/bash
 
# Nom du fichier d'entrée et de sortie
input_file="urls.txt"
output_file="results.csv"
 
# En-têtes du fichier CSV
echo "URL,Certificate Validity (UTC)" > "$output_file"
 
# Boucle à travers chaque URL du fichier d'entrée
while IFS= read -r url; do
    # Supprimer les espaces en début et fin d'URL
    url=$(echo "$url" | tr -d '[:space:]')
    
    # Vérifier si l'URL est vide
    if [ -z "$url" ]; then
        continue
    fi
    
    # Exécuter testssl et extraire le "Validity" du certificat
    # Utilisation de sed pour nettoyer la sortie
    validity=$(testssl --quiet "$url" 2>/dev/null | grep -i "Validity" | awk -F"(" '{print $2 $3}' | sed 's/)//g' | tr -d '\033[0m\033[1m\033[32m\033[31m')
    
    # Vérifier si une information de validité a été trouvée
    if [ -z "$validity" ]; then
        validity="Certificate information not found"
    else
        # Nettoyage supplémentaire si désiré, par exemple extraire des dates ou simplifier encore plus le texte
        validity=$(echo "$validity" | grep -oE "[0-9]+ >= [0-9]+ days.*" )
    fi
    
    # Ajouter les résultats au fichier CSV, en enlevant les caractères de contrôle et couleurs
    echo "$url,\"$validity\"" >> "$output_file"
done < "$input_file"
 
echo "Le fichier CSV a été créé avec succès : $output_file"

#!/bin/bash

# Définition des variables pour la connexion
USER_A="nom_utilisateur_a"              # Remplacez nom_utilisateur_a par le nom d'utilisateur sur la Machine A
HOST_A="adresse_ip_machine_A"           # Remplacez adresse_ip_machine_A par l'adresse IP de la Machine A
USER_B="nom_utilisateur_b"              # Remplacez nom_utilisateur_b par le nom d'utilisateur sur la Machine B (l'intermédiaire)
HOST_B="adresse_ip_machine_B"           # Remplacez adresse_ip_machine_B par l'adresse IP de la Machine B

# Option ProxyJump pour établir la connexion
# Utilisez cette méthode pour un environnement plus moderne avec OpenSSH 7.3 ou plus récent
ssh -J $USER_B@$HOST_B $USER_A@$HOST_A

# Si votre système utilise une version d'OpenSSH antérieure à 7.3, utilisez ProxyCommand à la place
# ssh -o ProxyCommand="ssh -W %h:%p $USER_B@$HOST_B" $USER_A@$HOST_A

echo "Connexion à $HOST_A par $HOST_B établie."

#!/bin/bash

# Ajout d'une adresse IP statique à l'interface réseau enp0s8
if ! ip addr add 10.10.0.230/24 dev enp0s8; then
    echo "Erreur lors de l'ajout de l'adresse IP à enp0s8. Assurez-vous que l'interface existe et que vous avez les permissions nécessaires."
    exit 1
else
    echo "Adresse IP 10.10.0.230/24 ajoutée avec succès à enp0s8."
fi

# Ajout d'une route pour la communication réseau
if ! ip route add 10.10.0.230/24 dev enp0s8; then
    echo "Erreur lors de l'ajout de la route pour l'interface enp0s8. Vérifiez la configuration."
    exit 1
else
    echo "Route pour 10.10.0.230/24 via enp0s8 ajoutée avec succès."
fi

# Définition des variables pour la connexion
USER_A="test"              # User machine A
HOST_A="192.168.0.1"       # IP machine A
USER_B="test"              # User machine B (intermediate)
HOST_B="10.0.22.100"       # IP machine B

echo "Tentative de connexion à $HOST_A via $HOST_B..."

# Option ProxyJump pour établir la connexion
# Utilisation de variables correctement intégrées dans la commande ssh
if ssh -J ${USER_B}@${HOST_B} ${USER_A}@${HOST_A}; then
    echo "Connexion à $HOST_A par $HOST_B établie avec succès."
else
    echo "Échec de la connexion. Vérifiez la configuration, le réseau, les permissions et les clés SSH."
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Adding a static IP address to network interface enp0s8
if ! ip addr add 10.10.0.230/24 dev enp0s8; then
    echo "Error adding IP address to enp0s8. Make sure the interface exists and you have the necessary permissions."
    exit 1
else
    echo "IP address 10.10.0.230/24 successfully added to enp0s8."
fi

# Adding a network route
if ! ip route add 10.10.0.230/24 dev enp0s8; then
    echo "Error adding route for interface enp0s8. Please check the configuration."
    exit 1
else
    echo "Route for 10.10.0.230/24 via enp0s8 added successfully."
fi

# Defining connection variables
USER_A="test"              # User on machine A
HOST_A="192.168.0.1"       # IP of machine A
USER_B="test"              # User on machine B (intermediate)
HOST_B="10.0.22.100"       # IP of machine B

echo "Attempting to connect to $HOST_A via $HOST_B..."

# ProxyJump option to establish the connection
# Using variables correctly integrated into the ssh command
if ssh -J ${USER_B}@${HOST_B} ${USER_A}@${HOST_A}; then
    echo "Connection to $HOST_A through $HOST_B successfully established."
else
    echo "Connection failed. Please check the configuration, network, permissions, and SSH keys."
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Définir l'adresse e-mail pour la clé SSH
email="your_email@example.com"

# Définir l'utilisateur et l'hôte de la machine distante
USER_B="test"              # Le nom d'utilisateur sur la machine B
HOST_B="10.0.22.100"       # L'adresse IP de la machine B

# Génération de la paire de clés SSH si elle n'existe pas déjà
if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa ]; then
    echo "Generating SSH keys..."
    ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "$email" -N "" -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa <<<y >/dev/null 2>&1
    echo "SSH keys generated."
else
    echo "SSH keys already exist."
fi

# Copie de la clé publique sur la machine B
echo "Copying SSH public key to $USER_B@$HOST_B..."
ssh-copy-id ${USER_B}@${HOST_B}

# Reste de votre script pour la connexion SSH, etc.

#!/bin/bash

# Variables
HOST_USER=$1  # Username on the remote host
HOST_IP=$2    # IP Address of the remote host
KEY_PATH="${HOME}/.ssh"
KEY_NAME="id_rsa_${HOST_IP}"
KEY="${KEY_PATH}/${KEY_NAME}"

# Check if SSH key already exists
if [ -f "${KEY}" ]; then
    echo "The SSH key ${KEY} already exists."
    exit 1
fi

# Generate SSH keys
ssh-keygen -b 2048 -t rsa -f "${KEY}" -q -N ""
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Failed to generate SSH key."
    exit 1
fi
echo "SSH key generated successfully."

# Copy the SSH key to the remote host
ssh-copy-id -i "${KEY}.pub" "${HOST_USER}@${HOST_IP}"
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Failed to copy SSH key to the remote host."
    exit 1
fi

echo "SSH key has been copied successfully. You can now SSH into ${HOST_USER}@${HOST_IP} without a password."

#!/bin/bash

# Выводим шапку
echo "Dev разбит так:"

# Получаем список всех устройств блочного хранения без вложенных разделов
for dev in $(lsblk -dn -o NAME,SIZE | grep -v └─ | awk '{print $1}'); do
  echo "$dev $(lsblk -dn -o SIZE /dev/$dev) Тб"
  # Для каждого устройства ищем его разделы и связанные монтирования
  for part in $(lsblk -o NAME,MOUNTPOINT /dev/$dev | grep └─ | awk '{print $1}'); do
    size=$(lsblk -dn -o SIZE /dev/$part)
    mount=$(lsblk -dn -o MOUNTPOINT /dev/$part | awk 'NF{print $1}')
    echo "$part $size /$mount"
  done
done

#!/bin/bash

# 配置变量
REPO_URL="https://github.com/your_username/your_repo.git" # 仓库URL
NEW_BRANCH="feature-branch" # 你想创建的新分支名
MAIN_BRANCH="main" # 主分支名
COMMIT_MESSAGE="Your commit message" # 提交信息
PR_TITLE="Title for your pull request" # PR的标题
PR_BODY="Description of changes made" # PR的描述
USERNAME="your_github_username" # GitHub用户名
TOKEN="your_github_token" # GitHub访问token，记得保密！

# 切换到主分支
git checkout $MAIN_BRANCH

# 更新仓库
git pull

# 创建并切换到新分支
git checkout -b $NEW_BRANCH

# 在这一步，你需要添加自己的代码修改。比如你可以自动修改一些文件或添加新文件。
# git add your_files
# git commit -m "$COMMIT_MESSAGE"

# 推送新分支到GitHub
git push --set-upstream origin $NEW_BRANCH

# 创建一个新的PR
# 这里会使用GitHub的CLI工具gh，你可能需要先行安装它
gh pr create --base $MAIN_BRANCH --title "$PR_TITLE" --body "$PR_BODY"

echo "Pull request has been created successfully."

@echo off
setlocal enabledelayedexpansion

:: Set the directory where your WAV files are located
set "sourceDir=C:\path\to\your\wav\files"

:: Set the output directory for the MP3 files
set "outputDir=C:\path\to\your\mp3\files"

:: Create the output directory if it does not exist
if not exist "%outputDir%" mkdir "%outputDir%"

:: Change the working directory to the source directory
cd /d "%sourceDir%"

:: Loop through each WAV file in the source directory and convert it to an MP3 file
for %%a in (*.wav) do (
    echo.
    echo Converting: "%%a"
    ffmpeg -i "%%a" -q:a 0 "%outputDir%\%%~na.mp3"
    echo Done.
)

echo.
echo All files have been converted.
pause

#!/bin/bash

   # Script to extract a file, edit, and then put it back into a tar.gz archive.

   # Check if the correct number of arguments were passed
   if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
       echo "Usage: $0 <archive.tar.gz> <file_to_edit>"
       exit 1
   fi

   ARCHIVE=$1
   FILE=$2
   TMP_DIR="tmp_$(date +%s)"

   # Create a temporary directory
   mkdir "$TMP_DIR"

   # Extract the specified file into the temporary directory
   tar -xzf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TMP_DIR" "$FILE"

   # Check if the file extraction was successful
   if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
       echo "Failed to extract $FILE from $ARCHIVE"
       exit 1
   fi

   # Edit the file
   vim "$TMP_DIR/$FILE"

   # Replace the modified file in the archive
   tar -czf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TMP_DIR" --remove-files "$FILE"

   # Cleanup
   rmdir "$TMP_DIR"

#!/bin/bash

# Ensure that a file name and archive name are provided
if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 <archive.tar.gz> <file_to_edit>"
    exit 1
fi

ARCHIVE=$1
FILE=$2
TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)

# Extract the specified file from the archive to a temporary directory
tar -xzf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE"

# Check if the extraction was successful
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Error: The file '$FILE' could not be extracted from the archive."
    exit 2
fi

echo "Editing the file: $FILE. Remember to save your changes."

# Open the file in the default editor
${EDITOR:-nano} "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE"

# Replace the edited file in the archive
# - Delete the old version of the file from the archive
# - Add the new version of the file to the archive
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE" "$FILE"
tar -rzf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE"

# Cleaning up
rm -r "$TEMP_DIR"

echo "The modified file has been added back to the archive."

#!/bin/bash

# Check if the correct number of arguments are passed
if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
  echo "Usage: $0 <archive.tar.gz> <file_to_edit>"
  exit 1
fi

# Assign command line arguments to variables
ARCHIVE=$1
FILE_TO_EDIT=$2

# Create a temporary directory to hold the file
TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)

# Extract the specified file to the temporary directory
tar -xzf $ARCHIVE -C $TEMP_DIR $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Check if the extraction was successful
if [ ! -f "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT" ]; then
  echo "The file $FILE_TO_EDIT does not exist in the archive $ARCHIVE."
  exit 1
fi

# Edit the file (replace 'nano' with your preferred text editor)
nano "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Replace the edited file in the archive
# First, remove the old version of the file from the archive
tar --delete -f $ARCHIVE $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Then, add the updated file to the archive
tar -uf $ARCHIVE -C $TEMP_DIR $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Cleaning up: Remove the temporary directory
rm -rf $TEMP_DIR

echo "Updated $FILE_TO_EDIT in $ARCHIVE."

# Clean up by removing the temporary directory

#!/bin/bash

# Set the name of the archive and the file to be edited
ARCHIVE="archive.tar.gz"
FILE_TO_EDIT="folder1/folder2/file.txt"

# Step 1: Extract the specified file from the archive
# Create a temporary directory to hold the file
TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)
tar -xzf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Making sure the file was extracted successfully
if [[ ! -f "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT" ]]; then
    echo "Failed to extract $FILE_TO_EDIT from $ARCHIVE"
    exit 1
fi

# Step 2: Open the file for editing
# Replace `nano` with your favorite editor, e.g., vim, emacs
nano "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Step 3: Updating the file in the archive
# First, remove the old version of the file from the archive
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Then, add the updated file back into the archive
# Note: We need to be in the right directory to preserve the relative path in the archive
(cd "$TEMP_DIR" && tar -rf "$PWD/$ARCHIVE" "$FILE_TO_EDIT")

# Compress the archive again (optional, only needed because the -r operation uncompresses the archive)
gzip -f "$ARCHIVE"

# Cleanup: Remove the temporary directory
rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"

echo "File $FILE_TO_EDIT has been updated in $ARCHIVE."

#!/bin/bash

# Specify filename and archive name
FILENAME="yourfile.txt"
ARCHIVENAME="yourarchive.tar.gz"

# Step 1: Extract file
# Check if the archive actually contains the file
if tar -tzf "$ARCHIVENAME" | grep -q "$FILENAME"; then
    # Extract the file
    tar -xzf "$ARCHIVENAME" "$FILENAME"
else
    echo "File $FILENAME does not exist in $ARCHIVENAME"
    exit 1
fi

# Step 2: Edit file
# Open the file with nano (or your preferred editor)
nano "$FILENAME"

# Step 3: Update the file in the archive
# First, remove the old version of the file from the archive
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVENAME" "$FILENAME"
# Then, add the updated version of the file to the archive
tar -uf "$ARCHIVENAME" "$FILENAME"

# Optional: recompress the archive. Some versions of tar do not support updating compressed archives directly. In that case, you'd decompress, update, and then recompress the archive.
gzip "$ARCHIVENAME"

echo "File $FILENAME has been updated in $ARCHIVENAME"

#!/bin/bash

# Define variables
ARCHIVE_NAME="archive.tar.gz"
FILE_TO_EDIT="file-to-edit.txt"
EXTRACT_DIR="./extracted"

# Step 1: Extract the file
mkdir -p $EXTRACT_DIR
tar -xzf $ARCHIVE_NAME -C $EXTRACT_DIR $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Check if the extraction was successful
if [ ! -f "$EXTRACT_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT" ]; then
    echo "The file was not found in the archive."
    exit 1
fi

# Step 2: Open the file for editing
echo "Editing $FILE_TO_EDIT. Make your changes and save the file."
# Replace 'nano' with your preferred text editor (e.g., vi, emacs, nano)
nano $EXTRACT_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT

# Step 3: Update the archive with the modified file
# Navigate to the extraction directory
cd $EXTRACT_DIR

# Update the archive
tar -uf "../$ARCHIVE_NAME" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Compress the updated archive. This step might be necessary as the -u option to tar doesn't compress the updated archive.
gzip -f "../$ARCHIVE_NAME"

# Move back to the original directory
cd ..

# Cleanup: Remove the extracted files and directory
rm -rf $EXTRACT_DIR

echo "The archive has been updated with the modified file."

#!/bin/bash

# Set the archive name and the file you want to edit
ARCHIVE_NAME="your_archive.tar.gz"
FILE_TO_EDIT="path/in/archive/toyourfile.txt"

# Create a temporary directory to extract file
TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)

# Make sure the temp directory was created
if [[ ! -d "$TEMP_DIR" ]]; then
  echo "Failed to create temp directory"
  exit 1
fi

# Extract the specific file to edit to the temporary directory
tar -xzvf "$ARCHIVE_NAME" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Check if extraction was successful
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "Failed to extract file from archive"
  exit 1
fi

# Edit the file with nano (replace 'nano' with your preferred editor if desired)
nano "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Update the file in the archive. Re-create the archive without the old file and then append the modified file.
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE_NAME" "$FILE_TO_EDIT" && tar -rvf "$ARCHIVE_NAME" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Check if the file was successfully replaced
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "File successfully replaced in the archive"
else
  echo "Failed to replace the file in the archive"
  exit 1
fi

# Clean up: remove the temporary directory
rm -r "$TEMP_DIR"

#!/bin/bash

# Defines the tar.gz archive and the file you want to extract for editing.
ARCHIVE_NAME="archive.tar.gz"
FILE_TO_EDIT="file_to_edit.txt"
TEMP_DIR="temp_dir"

# Step 1: Create a temporary directory to extract the file.
if [ ! -d "$TEMP_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir "$TEMP_DIR"
else
  echo "$TEMP_DIR exists. Cleaning it up."
  rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR/*"
fi

# Step 2: Extract the specific file to edit from the archive to the temporary directory.
tar xfz "$ARCHIVE_NAME" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Checking if extraction was successful
if [ ! -f "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT" ]; then
  echo "Extraction failed or file does not exist in the archive."
  exit 1
fi

# Step 3: Opens the file with your default editor. You can specify any editor you prefer (e.g., vim, nano, etc.).
echo "Editing $FILE_TO_EDIT. Save and close the editor once editing is done."
nano "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Step 4: Updates the archive with the edited file.
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE_NAME" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"
tar rf "$ARCHIVE_NAME" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Step 5: Cleanup: Optionally, delete the temporary directory.
# Comment out the next line if you wish to keep the temporary directory.
rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"

echo "$FILE_TO_EDIT has been updated in $ARCHIVE_NAME"

#!/bin/bash

# set -e stops the script if a command fails
set -e

# Define variables
ARCHIVE_PATH="/path/to/your/archive.tar.gz"
FILE_TO_EDIT="path/in/archive/to/yourfile.txt"
TMP_DIR="/tmp/archive_edit"
EXTRACTED_FILE_PATH="$TMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Step 1: Create a temporary working directory
mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"

# Step 2: Extract the archive
tar -xzf "$ARCHIVE_PATH" -C "$TMP_DIR"

# Step 3: Edit the file
# Here we use vim, but you can use nano, gedit, or any editor of choice
vim "$EXTRACTED_FILE_PATH"

# Step 4: Re-pack the archive
# Move to the temporary directory
cd "$TMP_DIR"

# Remove the original archive
rm -f "$ARCHIVE_PATH"

# Create a new archive with modified file
tar -czf "$ARCHIVE_PATH" .

# Step 5: Cleanup - remove the temporary directory
cd / && rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"

echo "File has been edited and the archive is updated."

#!/bin/bash

# Then, add the updated file back to the archive
tar -rzf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$TARGET_FILE"

#!/bin/bash

# Script to extract, edit, and update a file in a .tar.gz archive

# Check if correct number of arguments were given
if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 <tar.gz archive path> <file to edit>"
    exit 1
fi

ARCHIVE_PATH="$1"
FILE_TO_EDIT="$2"
TEMP_DIR="temp_extract_dir"

# Step 1: Extract the specified file
mkdir -p "$TEMP_DIR"
tar -xzf "$ARCHIVE_PATH" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Step 2: Edit the file
# Replace `nano` with your preferred editor
nano "${TEMP_DIR}/${FILE_TO_EDIT}"

# Check if file exists and was modified
if [ ! -f "${TEMP_DIR}/${FILE_TO_EDIT}" ]; then
    echo "Error: File not found after editing, aborting."
    exit 2
fi

# Step 3: Replace the file in the archive
# Note: GNU tar is required for "--delete" to work on .tar.gz archives.
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE_PATH" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"
tar -rzf "$ARCHIVE_PATH" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Clean up
rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"

echo "File '$FILE_TO_EDIT' has been updated in the archive '$ARCHIVE_PATH'."

#!/bin/bash

# Check if the correct number of arguments are provided
if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 archive_name.tar.gz file_to_edit"
    exit 1
fi

ARCHIVE_NAME=$1
FILE_TO_EDIT=$2
TMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)

# Check if the provided archive exists
if [ ! -f "$ARCHIVE_NAME" ]; then
    echo "The specified archive does not exist."
    exit 1
fi

# Extract the specified file to a temporary directory
tar -xzvf "$ARCHIVE_NAME" -C "$TMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Check if the extraction was successful
if [ ! -f "$TMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT" ]; then
    echo "The specified file does not exist within the archive."
    exit 1
fi

# Open the file for editing with the default text editor
${EDITOR:-vi} "$TMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Replace the modified file in the archive
# First, remove the old version of the file from the archive
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE_NAME" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Then, add the updated version of the file
tar --append --file="$ARCHIVE_NAME" -C "$TMP_DIR" "$FILE_TO_EDIT"

# Finally, recompress the archive
gzip -f "$ARCHIVE_NAME"

# Clean up the temporary directory
rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"

echo "The file $FILE_TO_EDIT has been updated in the archive $ARCHIVE_NAME."

# Check if the file was successfully extracted
if [[ ! -e "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE" ]]; then
    echo "File '$FILE' not found in the archive '$ARCHIVE'."
    rm -r "$TEMP_DIR"
    exit 2
fi

# Open the file with the default text editor. You can specify your editor of choice, e.g., vim, nano, etc.
${EDITOR-nano} "$TEMP_DIR/$FILE"

# Update the archive with the modified file
tar --delete -f "$ARCHIVE" "$FILE" 2>/dev/null # Ignore error if file does not exist in the archive
tar -rzf "$ARCHIVE" -C "$TEMP_DIR" "$FILE"

# Clean up
rm -r "$TEMP_DIR"

echo "Updated '$FILE' inside '$ARCHIVE'."

#!/bin/bash

# Check if the correct number of arguments are provided
if [ "$#" -ne 3 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 archive.tar.gz file_to_edit editor"
    exit 1
fi

ARCHIVE=$1
FILE_TO_EDIT=$2
EDITOR=$3

# Create a temporary directory for our work
TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)

# Extract the specified file to the temporary directory
tar -xzf $ARCHIVE -C $TEMP_DIR $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Check if the file was successfully extracted
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Failed to extract $FILE_TO_EDIT from $ARCHIVE"
    exit 2
fi

# Open the file in the specified editor
$EDITOR $TEMP_DIR/$FILE_TO_EDIT

# Check if the editor exited successfully
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Editing failed"
    exit 3
fi

# After editing, replace the file in the original archive
# Remove the original file from the archive without extracting other files
tar --delete -f $ARCHIVE $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Add the edited file back into the archive
tar -rzf $ARCHIVE -C $TEMP_DIR $FILE_TO_EDIT

# Check if the file was successfully updated
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Failed to update $FILE_TO_EDIT in $ARCHIVE"
    exit 4
fi

# Clean up: Remove the temporary directory
rm -rf $TEMP_DIR

echo "$FILE_TO_EDIT updated successfully in $ARCHIVE"

# 使用 Nginx 官方镜像作为基础镜像
FROM nginx:latest

# 安装依赖
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y build-essential libpcre3 libpcre3-dev zlib1g zlib1g-dev libssl-dev wget git

# 下载 Nginx 源码（确保与 Nginx 官方镜像中的版本相匹配）
RUN wget http://nginx.org/download/nginx-1.21.6.tar.gz && \
    tar -zxf nginx-1.21.6.tar.gz && \
    rm nginx-1.21.6.tar.gz

# 克隆 Brotli Nginx 模块
RUN git clone https://github.com/google/ngx_brotli.git && \
    cd ngx_brotli && \
    git submodule update --init

# 编译 Nginx 和 Brotli 模块
RUN cd nginx-1.21.6 && \
    ./configure --with-compat --add-dynamic-module=../ngx_brotli && \
    make modules

# 将编译的模块拷贝到 Nginx 目录 
RUN cp nginx-1.21.6/objs/*.so /etc/nginx/modules/

# 清理不必要的包和文件
RUN apt-get remove --purge -y build-essential wget git && \
    apt-get autoremove -y && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf nginx-1.21.6 ngx_brotli /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# 加载 Brotli 模块，可以通过在 Nginx 配置中引用
RUN echo 'load_module modules/ngx_http_brotli_filter_module.so;' >> /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
RUN echo 'load_module modules/ngx_http_brotli_static_module.so;' >> /etc/nginx/nginx.conf

#!/bin/bash

# 检查参数数量
if [ "$#" -ne 2 ]; then
  echo "Usage: $0 directory1 directory2"
  exit 1
fi

# 定义目录变量
dir1=$1
dir2=$2

# 使用diff命令递归比较两个目录
diff --brief -r "$dir1" "$dir2" | while read line; do
  if [[ $line == *"Only in"* ]]; then
    echo $line
  elif [[ $line == *"differ"* ]]; then
    echo $line

done

#!/bin/sh

dir1="/nas/8T/Software"
dir2="/nas/4T/4T/Software"

# 用于存储临时文件列表的文件
list1=$(mktemp)
list2=$(mktemp)

# 生成目录1的文件列表，忽略目录信息
find "$dir1" -type f -exec md5sum {} + | sort > "$list1"

# 生成目录2的文件列表，忽略目录信息
find "$dir2" -type f -exec md5sum {} + | sort > "$list2"

# 使用diff比较文件列表，找出差异
diff "$list1" "$list2" | grep -E "^[<|>]" | sed -e "s/^< //g" -e "s/^> //g" | cut -d' ' -f2- | while read file; do
  # 显示不一样的文件名
  if [[ "$file" ]]; then
    echo "Different file: $file"
  fi
done

# 清理临时文件
rm "$list1" "$list2"

timeout 1 bash -c 'cat < /dev/null > /dev/tcp/192.168.1.1/22'
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "Port is open"
else
    echo "Port is closed or host is unreachable"
fi

#!/bin/bash

ip="192.168.1.1"
port="22"
timeout_duration="1"

# Attempt to connect
timeout $timeout_duration bash -c "cat < /dev/null > /dev/tcp/${ip}/${port}"
exit_status=$?

# Check the exit status
if [ $exit_status -eq 124 ]; then
    echo "Error: Connection to ${ip} on port ${port} timed out."
elif [ $exit_status -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "OK: Port is open."
else
    echo "OK: Received a response (e.g., connection refused) which means the IP and port are reachable."
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Ellenőrzés, hogy a paraméter pozitív egész szám-e
if ! [[ "$1" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
    echo "nem"
    exit 1
fi

number=$1
i=1
sum=0

# Addig számoljuk a háromszögszámokat, amíg el nem érjük vagy meg nem haladjuk
# a megadott számot
while [ $sum -lt $number ]; do
    sum=$((sum + i))
    i=$((i + 1))
done

# Ha a ciklus után a sum értéke megegyezik a paraméterben kapott értékkel,
# akkor az a szám háromszögszám.
if [ $sum -eq $number ]; then
    echo "igen"
else
    echo "nem"
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Ellenőrizzük, hogy a bemeneti paraméter szám-e és pozitív-e
if ! [[ $1 =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
  echo "nem"
  exit 1
fi

# A bemeneti szám
number=$1
# Az első k szám összege
sum=0
# A k változó kezdeti értéke
k=0

# Addig iterálunk, amíg a sum kisebb, mint a bemeneti szám
while [ $sum -lt $number ]; do
  ((k++))
  sum=$((sum + k))
  if [ $sum -eq $number ]; then
    echo "igen"
    exit 0
  fi
done

# Ha a ciklusban nem találtunk egyezést, akkor nem háromszögszám
echo "nem"

#!/bin/bash

WATCHED_DIR="/nas/optane"
TARGET_DIR="/nas"

# 无限循环，监视WATCHED_DIR
inotifywait -m -e create -e moved_to --format '%w%f' "$WATCHED_DIR" | while read FILE
do
    # 检查文件是否为.mp4文件
    if [[ $FILE == *.mp4 ]]
    then
        # 如果是.mp4文件，将其移动到TARGET_DIR
        echo "Moving $FILE to $TARGET_DIR"
        mv "$FILE" "$TARGET_DIR"
    fi
done

@ECHO OFF
SET source=C:\sciezka\zrodlowa
SET target_img_a=C:\image-A
SET target_img_b=C:\image-B
SET target_base=C:\base

FOR /R %source% %%I IN (*.jpg, *.jpeg, *.png) DO (
    COPY "%%I" "%target_img_a%"
)

FOR /R %source% %%A IN (*.zip, *.rar, *.7z) DO (
    SET "archive=%%A"
    SET "arch_dir=%%~dpA\unpacked"

    7z x "-o%arch_dir%" "%%A"

    FOR /R %arch_dir% %%I IN (*.jpg, *.jpeg, *.png) DO (
        MOVE "%%I" "%target_img_b%"
        GOTO :continue
    )
    :continue

    FOR /R %arch_dir% %%I IN (*.*) DO (
        MOVE "%%I" "%target_base%"
    )

    RD /S /Q "%arch_dir%"
)

ECHO Operacja zakonczona.
PAUSE

#!/bin/bash

# Check if an argument is given (MKV file path)
if [ "$#" -ne 1 ]; then
  echo "Usage: $0 <MKV file>"
  exit 1
fi

MKV_FILE="$1"
# Use mkvmerge to get track info, filter to get subtitle tracks, then cut to get the track IDs
SUB_TRACKS=$(mkvmerge -i "$MKV_FILE" | grep subtitles | cut -d':' -f1 | cut -d' ' -f3)

# Loop through each subtitle track and extract it
for TRACK_ID in $SUB_TRACKS; do
  mkvextract tracks "$MKV_FILE" ${TRACK_ID}:"${MKV_FILE%.mkv}".$TRACK_ID.srt
done

#!/bin/bash

# Detect whether the input contains HDR metadata
hdr_present=$(ffprobe -v error -select_streams v:0 -show_entries stream=color_transfer=smpte2084 -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 /media/input.mkv)

# Base FFmpeg command with VA-API acceleration and HEVC encoding
ffmpeg_cmd_base="ffmpeg -hwaccel vaapi -hwaccel_device /dev/dri/renderD128 -extra_hw_frames 10 -i /media/input.mkv -vf 'format=nv12,hwupload' -c:v hevc_vaapi"

if [[ $hdr_present == "smpte2084" ]]; then
    echo "HDR content detected, encoding with HDR metadata preservation..."
    # HDR encoding logic here
    # This is a placeholder for HDR-related encoding options. 
    # Direct handling of HDR with VA-API in FFmpeg might be limited.
    $ffmpeg_cmd_base /temp/output.mkv
else
    echo "Standard content detected, encoding normally..."
    $ffmpeg_cmd_base /temp/output.mkv
fi

pip install numpy pandas scipy matplotlib seaborn scikit-learn jupyter notebook

# Install R and dependencies for RStudio Server
echo "Installing R and dependencies..."

# Downloading and installing RStudio Server
echo "Installing RStudio Server..."
wget https://download2.rstudio.org/server/arch/latest/rstudio-server-latest-amd64.deb
dpkg -i rstudio-server-latest-amd64.deb

# Fixing dependencies
apt-get install -f

# If on Arch Linux you encounter issues with directly installing the Debian package,
# consider building from source or using an AUR helper like yay:
# yay -S rstudio-server

# Install Docker
echo "Installing Docker..."
pacman -S docker --noconfirm

# Start and enable Docker service
systemctl start docker
systemctl enable docker

# Setup Docker without sudo (optional)
usermod -aG docker $(whoami)

# Install Jupyter Notebook (if not installed earlier with pip)
# echo "Installing Jupyter Notebook..."
# pip install jupyter notebook

# Running a simple test to confirm Jupyter Notebook installation
echo "Verifying Jupyter Notebook installation..."
jupyter notebook --version

# Informing user the setup has completed
echo "Data Science environment setup completed. You may need to restart to apply all changes properly."

# Block null packets (possible scan)
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --tcp-flags ALL NONE -j DROP
# Explanation: This rule drops packets that have no TCP flags set. These are often used in reconnaissance scans.

# Drop SYN packets that are not the start of a connection
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp ! --syn -m state --state NEW -j DROP
# Explanation: Drops TCP packets that claim to be starting a new connection but do not have the SYN flag set. This can prevent certain types of spoofing attacks.

# Drop XMAS packets
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --tcp-flags ALL ALL -j DROP
# Explanation: Drops packets with all TCP flags set. Such "XMAS" packets are often used in scans and do not belong to legitimate traffic.

# Allow established and related connections
iptables -A INPUT -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -j ACCEPT
# Explanation: This rule allows packets that are part of or related to an existing connection. It’s crucial for allowing legitimate traffic to flow freely.

# Limiting Ping Requests
iptables -A INPUT -p icmp -m icmp --icmp-type echo-request -m limit --limit 1/s -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p icmp -m icmp --icmp-type echo-request -j DROP
# Explanation: These rules limit the incoming ICMP echo requests (pings) to 1 per second. The first rule allows pings subject to this rate limit, while the second drops excess pings, mitigating ping flood attacks.

# Block packets from private subnets on a public interface
iptables -A INPUT -i eth0 -s 10.0.0.0/8 -j DROP
iptables -A INPUT -i eth0 -s 172.16.0.0/12 -j DROP
iptables -A INPUT -i eth0 -s 192.168.0.0/16 -j DROP
# Explanation: These rules block packets that claim to be from private IP ranges but are arriving on a public-facing interface, indicative of spoofing.

# Replace eth0 with the appropriate public-facing network interface on your system.

#!/bin/bash

# The file you wish to copy
FILE_TO_COPY="/path/to/your/file"

# Destination path on the remote host
DEST_PATH="/remote/path"

# The process name you wish to kill on the remote hosts
PROCESS_NAME="your_process_name"

# List of remote hosts (space-separated)
REMOTE_HOSTS="host1.example.com host2.example.com host3.example.com"

# Loop through each host
for HOST in $REMOTE_HOSTS; do
    echo "Processing $HOST"

    # Copy the file to the remote host
    scp $FILE_TO_COPY ${HOST}:${DEST_PATH} &&
    echo "File copied to $HOST successfully" ||
    echo "Failed to copy file to $HOST"

    # Run pkill command on the remote host
    ssh ${HOST} "pkill -f ${PROCESS_NAME}" &&
    echo "pkill command executed on $HOST successfully" ||
    echo "Failed to execute pkill command on $HOST"

done

remote_hosts="host1.example.com host2.example.com host3.example.com"

# Loop through each host and perform the operations
for host in $remote_hosts; do
    echo "Copying file to ${host}..."
    scp "$local_file" "${host}:${remote_file}"
    
    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "File successfully copied to ${host}."
    else
        echo "Failed to copy file to ${host}."
        continue
    fi

    echo "Running remote command on ${host}..."
    ssh "${host}" "$remote_command"
    
    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "Command successfully executed on ${host}."
    else
        echo "Failed to execute command on ${host}."
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

# Usage: ./script.sh file_to_copy host_list remote_path

FILE_TO_COPY=$1
HOST_LIST=$2
REMOTE_PATH=$3

# Command to be executed on the remote machine(s).
# Tailor this command to your specific needs (e.g., replace 'process_name' with the actual name).
PKILL_COMMAND="pkill -f process_name"

if [ "$#" -ne 3 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 [File to Copy] [Host List] [Remote Path]"
    exit 1
fi

# Check if the file to copy exists
if [ ! -f "$FILE_TO_COPY" ]; then
    echo "Error: File $FILE_TO_COPY not found."
    exit 1
fi

# Check if the host list file exists
if [ ! -f "$HOST_LIST" ]; then
    echo "Error: Host list file $HOST_LIST not found."
    exit 1
fi

# Main loop to iterate over hosts
while IFS= read -r host
do
    echo "Copying $FILE_TO_COPY to $host:$REMOTE_PATH"
    scp "$FILE_TO_COPY" "${host}:$REMOTE_PATH"
    # Check if SCP was successful
    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "Successfully copied $FILE_TO_COPY to $host:$REMOTE_PATH"
        echo "Executing pkill command on $host"
        ssh "$host" "$PKILL_COMMAND"
        if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
            echo "Successfully executed pkill command on $host"
        else
            echo "Failed to execute pkill command on $host"
        fi
    else
        echo "Failed to copy $FILE_TO_COPY to $host:$REMOTE_PATH"
    fi
done < "$HOST_LIST"

echo "Done."

#!/bin/bash

file_to_copy="path/to/file"
remote_hosts=("host1" "host2" "host3")

# Copy the file to each remote host
for host in "${remote_hosts[@]}"; do
    scp $file_to_copy user@$host:~/file
done

# Run pkill command on each remote host
for host in "${remote_hosts[@]}"; do
    ssh user@$host "pkill -f process_to_kill"
done

echo "File copied and pkill command executed on all remote hosts."

#!/bin/bash

host=192.168.50.151

for port in {1..1024}; do
    # Using nc to check each port with a timeout of 1 second
    nc -z -w1 $host $port && echo "TCP port $port is open"
done

#!/bin/bash

host=192.168.50.151

for port in {1..1024}; do
    # Using timeout to stop attempt after 1 second
    timeout 1 bash -c "echo > /dev/tcp/$host/$port" && echo "TCP port $port is open" || echo "TCP port $port is closed"
done

LEVEL LIST OF AT HELL'S GATE

### ORBITAL STATIONS ###

SUN OUTPOST (DERELICT)

MERCURY OUTPOST (DERELICT)

VENUS OUTPOST (DERELICT)

EARTH OUTPOST (DERELICT)

MARS OUTPOST (INHABITED)

### MERCURY ###

{I} "Tales of Icarus" - Drawing parallels to the Greek myth of Icarus who flew too close to the sun, this zone reflects the scorched, barren landscape of Mercury, a planet closest to our Sun.

{II} "Mercurial Maze" - Inspired by the shifting and volatile nature attributed to the deity Mercury in mythology, this sector is a labyrinth of caves and tunnels beneath Mercury's surface.

{III} "The Silent Crater" - Named after the haunting silence that defines Mercury's eerie, crater-filled landscape. This sector takes cues from sci-fi horror media, emphasizing isolation and desolation.

{IV} "Caloris Nights" - A reference to the Caloris Basin, one of Mercury's most prominent features. This sector plays on the contrast between the extreme day and night temperatures on the planet, with "nights" being a metaphor for the darker aspects of exploration and the human psyche.

### VENUS ###

{I} "Cytherean Dreams" - Venus, known as Cytherea in ancient mythology, represents unattainable beauty and mystery. This sector, covered in thick, acidic clouds, is both beautiful and deadly, inspired by tales of forbidden desires.

{II} "Acid Reign" - A play on words, this sector highlights the harsh, corrosive atmosphere of Venus with landscapes shaped by acid rain, a nod to dystopian futures seen in cyberpunk media.

{III} "The Greenhouse" - Referencing Venus's runaway greenhouse effect, this sector presents challenges of extreme heat and pressure, mirroring themes of survival against nature's wrath seen in various forms of media.

{IV} "Aphrodite's Isolation" - Named after the goddess of love and beauty, this sector emphasizes the loneliness of Venus in the solar system, akin to a tragic heroine in literature, surrounded by beauty yet unreachable.

### EARTH ###

{I} "Garden of Eden" - A stark contrast to the vibrant life once present, now a silent, empty echo of Earth's former glory, inviting introspection on paradise lost, much like the biblical tale.

{II} "Atlantis Ascend" - Drawing from the legend of the lost city of Atlantis, this sector represents the depths of the oceans and the mysteries swallowed by the Earth, encouraging exploration of the unknown.

{III} "Babel's Shadow" - Reflecting on the story of the Tower of Babel, this sector showcases the remains of humanity's ambition, now fallen and disjointed, a reminder of the challenges of communication and unity.

{IV} "Among the Stars" - Speaking to the eternal human quest to reach beyond our grasp, this sector, filled with the ruins of spaceports and launch sites, pays homage to our ceaseless fascination with the heavens.

### MARS ###

{I} "Valles Marineris Vista" - Named for the vast canyon system on Mars, this sector embodies the exploration and discovery spirit, echoing the adventurous heart of space westerns and frontier tales.

{II} "Olympus Mons Base" - Referring to the solar system's tallest volcano, this sector represents man's attempt to conquer the unconquerable, inspired by stories of ambition and hubris akin to those in Greek tragedies.

{III} "Red Eden" - Combining the red planet with the notion of starting anew, this sector is themed around colonization and the human drive to find a new beginning, pulling from genres like utopian and dystopian fiction.

{IV} "Phobos Phantoms" - Incorporating Phobos, one of Mars's moons, this sector delves into themes of fear and the unknown, drawing inspiration from psychological thrillers and horror, where what terrifies us most is often what we do not understand.

#!/bin/bash

# Default pass_prefix value
pass_prefix="ansible/vault"

# Parse arguments
while [[ "$#" -gt 0 ]]; do
    case $1 in
        --vault-id) id="$2"; shift ;;
        *) echo "Unknown parameter passed: $1"; exit 1 ;;
    esac
    shift
done

# Check if id is provided
if [ -z "$id" ]; then
    echo "Vault ID not provided. Use --vault-id to specify it."
    exit 1
fi

# Execute pass command with the specified prefix and ID
exec pass "${pass_prefix}/${id}"

#!/bin/bash
pass_prefix="ansible/vault"
while getopts "i:" option; do
    case $option in
        i) id=$OPTARG;;
        *) echo "Usage: $0 -i <vault-id>"; exit 1;;
    esac
done

if [[ -z $id ]]; then
    echo "Error: vault-id is required"
    exit 1
fi

pass "$pass_prefix/$id"

#!/bin/bash

# Initialize default values
pass_prefix="ansible/vault"
id=""

# Parse command-line options
while getopts ":vault-id:" opt; do
  case ${opt} in
    vault-id )
      id=$OPTARG
      ;;
    \? ) echo "Usage: cmd [-vault-id]"
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# Execute the pass command with the provided id
exec pass "$pass_prefix/$id"

#!/bin/bash

# Initialize default values
pass_prefix="ansible/vault"
id=""

# Function to display usage
usage() {
  echo "Usage: $0 --vault-id=ID"
  exit 1
}

# Parse command-line arguments
while [[ "$#" -gt 0 ]]; do
  case $1 in
    --vault-id=*) id="${1#*=}";;
    *) usage ;;
  esac
  shift
done

# Check if vault-id was provided
if [ -z "$id" ]; then
  echo "Error: --vault-id is required"
  usage
fi

# Execute the pass command
exec pass "$pass_prefix/$id"

    COMMAND lcov --directory ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR} --capture --output-file coverage.info

#!/bin/bash
    FILE=/path/to/your/alive.file
    MAXAGE=60 # File should be updated within the last 60 seconds

    if [ ! -f "$FILE" ]; then
        echo "$FILE does not exist."
        exit 1
    fi

    if [ "$(( $(date +%s) - $(stat -c %Y $FILE) ))" -gt "$MAXAGE" ]; then
        echo "$FILE is older than $MAXAGE seconds."
        exit 1
    fi

    exit 0

# Start by defining the BUILD_TYPE variable
ARG BUILD_TYPE=dev

# Use the RUN command with a shell conditional statement to define ENTRY_POINT based on BUILD_TYPE
RUN if [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "dev" ]; then \
        echo "export ENTRY_POINT=development_entrypoint.sh" >> /etc/profile; \
    else \
        echo "export ENTRY_POINT=production_entrypoint.sh" >> /etc/profile; \
    fi

# Alternatively, directly set the ENV based on the condition using shell form in RUN command
# This will make the ENV available for the image but in a less direct way
RUN export ENTRY_POINT=$(if [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "dev" ]; then echo "development_entrypoint.sh"; else echo "production_entrypoint.sh"; fi) && echo "export ENTRY_POINT=$ENTRY_POINT" >> /etc/profile

# Note that the ENV set in RUN command may not be persistently available in subsequent steps or in containers started from the built image.
# For the environment variable to persist, you would ideally set it in the container's environment explicitly:

ENV ENTRY_POINT=development_entrypoint.sh

# If you require dynamic evaluation at runtime, you might need to use an entrypoint script that evaluates BUILD_TYPE and sets ENTRY_POINT accordingly.

<?php

// Путь к исходному файлу
$inputFilePath = 'file.txt';
// Путь к результирующему файлу
$outputFilePath = 'output.txt';

// Считываем содержимое файла в строку
$inputContent = file_get_contents($inputFilePath);
if ($inputContent === false) {
    die("Не удалось открыть файл $inputFilePath");
}

// Преобразование содержимого
// Удаляем пробелы между скобками
$transformedContent = str_replace(' ', '', $inputContent);

// Заменяем ))) на ))) \n, чтобы каждая скобочная группировка начиналась с новой строки
// Предполагаем, что каждый блок закрыт корректно
$transformedContent = str_replace(')))', ")))\n", $transformedContent);

// Убираем последний перенос строки, если он есть
$transformedContent = rtrim($transformedContent);

// Записываем преобразованное содержимое в новый файл
$result = file_put_contents($outputFilePath, $transformedContent);
if ($result === false) {
    die("Не удалось записать в файл $outputFilePath");
}

echo "Преобразование завершено успешно.\n";

?>

<?php

// Путь к файлу
$filePath = 'file.txt';

// Чтение содержимого файла
$fileContent = file_get_contents($filePath);

// Проверка успешности чтения файла
if ($fileContent !== false) {
    // Удаление пробелов между скобками и разделение результата на две строки
    $processedContent = str_replace(' ', '', $fileContent) . " \n " . str_replace(' ', '', $fileContent) . " \n";

    // Запись преобразованного содержимого обратно в файл или в новый файл
    if (file_put_contents('updated_file.txt', $processedContent) !== false) {
        echo "Файл успешно обработан и сохранен как 'updated_file.txt'.\n";
    } else {
        echo "Ошибка при записи файла.\n";
    }
} else {
    echo "Ошибка при чтении файла.\n";
}

<?php
// Dati sensibili che vuoi criptare
$data = "Segreto molto importante";

// Genera una chiave segreta (in produzione, usa una chiave generata in modo sicuro!)
$chiaveSegreta = openssl_random_pseudo_bytes(32);

// IV sta per Initialization Vector, che è richiesto dalla maggior parte dei modi di operazione
$iv = openssl_random_pseudo_bytes(openssl_cipher_iv_length('aes-256-cbc'));

// Cripta i dati
$datiCriptati = openssl_encrypt($data, 'aes-256-cbc', $chiaveSegreta, 0, $iv);
echo "Dati Criptati: " . $datiCriptati . "\n";

// Per decriptare
$datiDecriptati = openssl_decrypt($datiCriptati, 'aes-256-cbc', $chiaveSegreta, 0, $iv);
echo "Dati Decriptati: " . $datiDecriptati . "\n";
?>
